text.p: The following are leading domestic stories in Portuguese newspapers.
- The International Monetary Fund says Portugal's economic outlook improving but it still sees deficit next year above EMU target.
- The world's eighth-largest tobacco group Seita criticises the way Portugal's Tabaqueira is being privatised.
- GEC-Alsthom will give Sorefame train construction work if it wins the contract for a railway across the river Tagus.
- Mobile phone company TMN to formalise in a few weeks a contract with banking services group Sociedade Interbancaria de Servicos.
- Portugal's second-largest trade union UGT wants salaries one pct above the European Union average.
- Trade unions back government plans to tighten tax screw on the self-employed but employers are against Prime Minister Antonio Guterres' scheme.
